FuncDef: The display isis srv6 ti-lfa-node command displays TI-LFA information on a specified node.
CLIs: display isis [ <process-id> ] srv6 ti-lfa-node [ ipv6 ] [ level-1 | level-2 ] [ systemid <systemid> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a process whose TI-LFA information about nodes is to be displayed.
If this parameter is not configured, TI-LFA information of all processes is displayed.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Displays TI-LFA information on IPv6 nodes.
-

Displays TI-LFA information on nodes in Level-1 areas.
-

Displays TI-LFA information on nodes in Level-2 areas.
If no level is specified, TI-LFA information of nodes in all areas is displayed.
-

Specifies the system ID or pseudo node ID.
The value is a hexadecimal integer in the format of XXXX.XXXX.XXXX.

Examples: Topology Independent LFA Node Table for ISIS(1)
ISIS(1) Level-1 Topology Independent LFA Node Table
ISIS(2) Level-1 Topology Independent LFA Node Table
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After IS-IS TI-LFA FRR is configured on a device, run the display isis srv6 ti-lfa-node command to view TI-LFA information of a specific node or all nodes. The command output contains the P node's prefix, outbound interface name, next-hop IP address, P and Q nodes, and P-to-Q label stack.
